snippet: Marie Malchodi, who works as a “book conservation technician” at Brown University, recently came across a piece of paper signed by “P. Revere Sculp” — and knew it might be a big find.
abstract: Dan Barry This Land column recounts Marie Malchodi's discovery of a rare engraving by Paul Revere at Brown University's John Hay Library; notes that Malchodi, a book conservation technician, found the print folded up and tucked into an 18th-century medical text. Photos, Map (M)/
lead_paragraph: PROVIDENCE, R.I. Day after day, a tall, shy woman weaves her way unnoticed through the earnest and learned campus swirl of Brown University. She enters the hush of a library, then promptly vanishes from sight.

headline.main: A Rarity, Even for the Rare Book Room
